question: Question 2-02/13/2013 Which of the following is the definition for reactivity (ρ)?

answers.answer: a. The measure of a reactor’s departure from criticality
answers.feedback: Correct.

answers.answer: b. The time required for power to change by a factor of “e”
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory Vol. 2.

answers.answer: c. The fraction of all fission neutrons that are born as delayed neutrons
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory Vol. 2.

answers.answer: d. The faction of number of neutrons of current generation and number of neutrons of the previous generation
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory Vol. 2.

question: Question 4-02/13/2013 Reactor is at full power. The operator immediately scrams all control rods into the core. This IMMEDIATE insertion of all control rods will cause: Given: T: reactor period, l*: Prompt neutron lifetime; ρ: reactivity insertion; β: beta fraction

answers.answer: a. The delayed period to be equal to POSITIVE 80 seconds
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, Sec 4.6, page 4-17

answers.answer: b. A number of prompt neutrons equals to a number of delayed neutrons
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, Sec 4.6, page 4-17

answers.answer: c. The immediate period to be a function of the prompt neutron lifetime (T=l*/ρ)
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1988, Sec 4.6, page 4-17

answers.answer: d. A sudden change of power that equals to the initial power multiplied by β(1- ρ)/ (β -ρ)
answers.feedback: Correct.

question: Question 10-02/13/2013 Which ONE of the following correctly describes the effect of reactor reactivity when the fuel temperature increases?

answers.answer: a. There is no reactivity effect when fuel temperature increases
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory Vol. 2

answers.answer: b. The increase in fuel temperature will begin to create a positive reactivity effect
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory Vol. 2

answers.answer: c. The increase in fuel temperature will begin to create a negative reactivity effect
answers.feedback: Correct.

answers.answer: d. As the fuel heats up the void in fuel increases, thereby, creating a positive reactivity effect
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: DOE Fundamentals Handbook Nuclear Physics and Reactor Theory Vol. 2
